page.title: 06CAER LLAN,LYDART
page.content: Caer Llan Field Studies Centre stands in 25 acres of woodland,pasture and garden,and since 1970 has been able to take up to 60 people for short residential stays. The woods were declared a Site of Special Scientific Interest in l983. Students study many subjects - land- scaping,surveying,biology and other sciences. They come from schools and colleges at home and abroad. The house itself is in the process of being enlarged and rebuilt,a big underground extension being the current project. The emphasis of this work is A) durability - the structure is designed to last for centuries; B) low energy - using solar gains,earth sheltering and dense thermally stable materials and extra insulation; C) low maintenance - in years to come it should be very cheap to run.
